panels.description:
UPTIME: measures the time from the last reboot/ power on of the server till now.
>Uptime < 1min means that the VM was rebooted 1 min ago.
panels.title: UPTIME (time)

panels.description: - Number of sessions registered in logind.
panels.title: LOGIND (tty)

panels.description:
Load for 1m > 2 means a possible problem.
- Actual Treshold is 6.
panels.title: LOAD 1m

panels.description:
Load for 5m > 2 means a possible problem.
- Actual Treshold is 6.
panels.title: LOAD 5m

panels.description:
Load for 15m > 2 means a possible problem.
- Actual Treshold is 6.
panels.title: LOAD 15m

panels.description:
Bits of available entropy.
- Critical:
  - If < 500 there is a problem.
The following command will tell you the available entropy in your system:

$ cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/entropy_avail
The consensus is that numbers below 1000 will lead to processes blocking waiting for more entropy.
panels.title: ENTROPY

panels.description: Uname
panels.title: Kernel

panels.description: Number of Forks.
panels.title: FORKS

panels.description:
Used CPU from a total available of 100%.
- CPUThreshold:
 >Critical: > 90% Used CPU
panels.title: CPU Used

panels.description:
Used Memory from a total available of 100%.
- Memory Threshold:
 >Critical: > 85% Used Memory
panels.title: MEMORY Used

panels.description:
Used Swap from a total available of 100%.
- Swap Threshold:
 >Critical: > 75% Used Swap
panels.title: SWAP Used

panels.description:
Reads + Writes = Total.
- Critical:
  - If > 500 iops then there is a High Load.
panels.title: Disk IOPs

panels.description:
DISK seconds Read/ Write Latency.
- Critical:
  - Recommended performance value is < 10ms as avg value of the Avg Disk sec/Read,Write.
  - Critical value of the Avg Disk sec/Read,Write is > 50ms, should not exceed this value.
panels.title: DISK RW Latency

panels.description:
Whether an error occurred while getting statistics for the given device.
> A value > 0 Means that there are some problems with that device.
panels.title: FILESYSTEM Device Error

panels.description:
Filesystem used space.
> If is > 80% then is Critical.
panels.title: FILESYSTEM Space Used

panels.description:
Filesystem used file nodes.
> If is > 85% the is Critical.
panels.title: FILESYSTEM Inodes Used

panels.description:
- Valid operstate for interface.
  - UP = 1
  - DOWN = 0
panels.title: NETWORK INTERFACE State

panels.description:
IN/ OUT Traffic rate.
- Critical:
  - If IN/OUT traffic = 0% from a total of 100% possible on that interface there is Low Bandwidth or interface problem.
  - If IN/OUT traffic > 95% from a total of 100% possible on that interface there is High Bandwidth.

95% (0.95 x 1e+09 =0.95 x 1 x 10^9 = 0.884756 GB, Gigabytes) supposing that the interface is 1 GB.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Traffic

panels.description:
Network Packets for IN/OUT.
- Critical:
   - If  is = 0 for IN/OUT.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Packets

panels.description:
Network Drops.
- Critical:
   - If  is > 0 then are Drops on that interface (IN/OUT) and is not ok.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Drops

panels.description:
Network Errors on IN/OUT.
- Critical:
  - If Errors > 0 then there are some problems on that interface.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Errors

panels.description:
Used FILE DESCRIPTORS from a total available of 100%.
- FILE DESCRIPTORS Threshold:
 >Critical: > 90% Used FILE DESCRIPTORS
panels.title: FILE DESCRIPTORS Used

panels.description:
Processes used File Descriptors.
- Critical:
   - If > 85% then there is High Usage.
panels.title: PROCESSES FILE DESCRIPTORS Used

panels.description:
- Critical:
   - If > 0 then the health of NTP is affected.

- Aggregate NTPD health including stratum, leap flag, sane freshness, root distance being less than collector.ntp.max-distance and causality violation being less than collector.ntp.local-offset-tolerance.
- Causality violation is lower bound estimate of clock error done using SNTP, it's calculated as positive portion of abs(node_ntp_offset) - node_ntp_rtt / 2.
panels.title: NTP Sanity

panels.description: - System NTP Leap Seconds > 0, where 0 â€“ OK, 1 â€“ add leap second at UTC midnight, 2 â€“ delete leap second at UTC midnight, 3 â€“ unsynchronised.
panels.title: NTP Leap Seconds

panels.description:
Used THREADS from a total available of 100%.
- THREADS Threshold:
 >Critical: > 85% Used THREADS
panels.title: Processes: THREADS Used

panels.description:
- PROCESS STATE CODES
   - R  running or runnable (on run queue)
   - D  uninterruptible sleep (usually IO)
     -S  interruptible sleep (waiting for an event to complete)
    - Z  defunct/zombie, terminated but not reaped by its parent
    - T  stopped, either by a job control signal or because
      it is being traced
panels.title: Processes: State
